name: António Castro
cv:
Bio:

  • António Vieira de Castro has a Master’s Degree in Multimedia Technology and is doing his PhD here in representation of both by FEUP.
  • He is a professor at ISEP-P. Porto in the Computer Engineering department and is responsible for the Curricular Units related to Interfaces and Design and Image, Audio and Video of the Masters in Computer Engineering.
  • From 2014 to 2021, he was Director of the DEI Multimedia Laboratory.
  • From 2006 to 2021, he was coordinator of the Multimedia and Medicine research area of ​​the GILT group (Games, Interaction and Learning Technologies).
  • He has supervised more than 50 master’s theses and 3 completed doctoral theses and several projects.
  • He was the principal local investigator of an H2020 project and FCT projects and participated in many
    others in recent years.
  • He is a member of the E-IPP (Pedagogical Innovation Unit of P. Porto) and a member of the CCRAV (Virtual and Augmented Reality Skills Center) of P. Porto.

Main interests: Interactive Systems, Multimedia, Educational Technology, Innovative Teaching, Voice Recognition, Virtual Computer Vision and Augmented Reality, IOT, Home Automation, among others.

name: Maria Antónia G. Rodrigues
cv:
Bio:

  • Maria Antónia G. Rodrigues is a senior lecturer at the business school of Polytecnic of Porto.
  • She is a director of bachelor in Marketing, researcher at CEOS P.Porto and has published several papers.
  • Supervision of master’s theses and participation in R & D projects.
  • Maria Antónia Rodrigues has also a professional experience in business services, bank, telecomunications and cars’ trade.

Main interests: Interactive Marketing

name: José Marílio Oliveira Cardoso
cv:
Bio:

  • Marílio Cardoso has a BSc (5 years degree) in Electrical Engineering – Power Systems, School of Engineering (ISEP) of P.Porto and he is finishing a PhD in Information Technology Research Research, at University of Santiago de Compostela.
  • He is a lecturer at ISEP – P. Porto on the department of Computer Engineering.
  • He has been instructor in several courses on energy efficiency and use of energy.
  • In 2014 he was instructor in the summer course “Engineering for Sustainable Development”.
  • He has been member of Multimedia Lab of DEI.
  • Since 2008 he is member of ISEP Sustainable Commission.
  • Since 2018 he is member of the pedagogical council of ISEP.
  • Since 2020 he is subdirector of the department of Computer Engineering o ISEP.
  • He authored or co-authored several conference papers.
  • He has participated in two international projects.

Main interests: Learning to code, innovative educational systems and solutions, centered in the teaching of computer science and multimedia.

name: Tânia Rocha
cv:
Bio:

  • Tânia Rocha, PhD in Informatics and M.Sc. in Communication and Multimedia.
  • She is Assistant Professor at the University of Trás-os-Montes and Alto Douro (UTAD) and Senior Researcher at INESC TEC-Associated Laboratory.
  • His main research interests are in the field of Human-Computer Interaction, with an emphasis on Multimedia, Digital Accessibility and Usability.
  • She won 3 national and 1 international artistic and scientific awards. In addition, she has produced more than 50 academic papers, including book chapters, articles and communications in annals, and has supervised several undergraduate projects (10 course conclusion projects) and postgraduate (5 doctoral and 8 masters) projects .
  • She is one of the co-founders of L.AV.A. – Audiovisuals and Accessibility Laboratory.

Main  interests:  Information Systems and Technologies, Information Management and BCs in Computer Science, among others.

name: José Marinho
cv:
Bio:

  • José Marinho is a professor from 1994 in Computer Engineering Department (DEI) School of Engineering of the Polytechnic Institute of Porto (ISEP-IPP).
  • He holds a PhD in Electrical Engineering University of Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro (UTAD), field of Decision Support Systems, 2006.
  • Member ofResearch Group on Knowledge Engineering and Decision Support (GECAD), 1995-2010.

Main interests: Intelligent Decision Support Systems, Intelligent Interfaces & User Intent Identification, Artificial Intelligence & Knowledge-based Systems, among others.

name: Nuno Coelho
cv:
Bio:

  • Nuno Mateus-Coelho is Professor and author of the book Information Security, Systems Intrusion, Cloud Security, Graphic Computing and Data Privacy at the Polytechnic Institute of Management and Technology (ISLA) and at the Polytechnic Institute of Cavadoand Ave (IPCA), Portugal .
  • He holds a BEng. in Information Systems and Multimedia Engineering, MEng. PhD in Computer Science Engineering at Polytechnic of Porto – School of Engineering (ISEP) in the area and discipline of cloud security and secure operating systems, and a PhD.
  • PhD in Computer Science from the University of Trás-os-Montes and Alto Douro (UTAD) in the area and discipline of information security and secure operating systems.
  • He is a European Commission accredited specialist in R&I projects in the Horizon 2020, COSME and CEF programs in the area of ​​information technologies. He is a TED and KeyNoteSpeaker; GDPR & DPO Expert in several Portuguese companies, ISO 27K Expert, COBIT & ITIL Expert; Certified cybersecurity expert, CEO and founder of NRMC.PT. and Manager of Altran 5GLAB.

Main interests: Cybersecurity, Multimedia Systems, information technologies

name: Paulo Sérgio dos Santos Matos
cv:
Bio:

  • Paulo Matos has a postgraduate studies in Industrial Computing from FEUP, and a PhD in Computer Science from UTAD.
  • He is a lecturer at ISEP – P. Porto on the Computer Science Department, lecturing several Course Units in the areas of graphical systems, interaction, computer aided engineering and computer science, in the courses of computer engineering and systems engineering.
  • He will be the next director of Multimedia Lab from DEI-ISEP.

Main interests: Graphical Systems, Interactive Systems, Computer Vision Virtual and Augmented Reality, Computer Aided Engineering, 3D Printing, Arduino programming, IOT, Domotic among others

name: Nuno Filipe Teixeira Malheiro
cv:
Bio:

  • Nuno Malheiro de Castro has a PhD on Electronics and Computer Engineering From UTAD.
  • He is a lecturer at ISEP – P. Porto on the department of Computer Engeneering and responsable from Course Units related with Advanced Programming techniques in the Master Degree on Informatic engineering.
  • He has participated on several research projects on past years.

Main interests: Intelligent Systems, Temporal Reasoning, Reasoning with Incomplete Information, among others.

name: Francisco Restivo
cv:
Bio:

  • Francisco J. Restivo (IEEE Member’71, Life Member’2013) is an Associate Professor at the Faculty of Philosophy and Social Sciences of the Catholic University of Portugal since 2010 and a researcher at LIACC – Laboratory of Artificial Intelligence and Informatics at the University of Porto.
  • His research interests include Digital Signal Processing, Systems, Systems of Systems, Complexity, and Social and Economic Networks. He is also Scientific Director and member of the Board of Directors of IDIT-Institute for Technological Development and Innovation of Santa Maria da Feira, Portugal, since 1999.
  • Previously, he was Associate Professor in the Department of Informatics Engineering of the Superior School of Engineering of the University of Porto since 1988. Dr. Restivo has a degree in D.Phil.

name: João Azevedo
cv:
Bio:

  • João Azevedo holds a degree in Multimedia Engineering and obtained the title of specialist in the audiovisual and media production area in 2016. He began his professional career in 1998 as a web programmer and later as a multimedia producer. Its route highlights the development of the Site of the Hospital Santa Maria do Porto, the platform “Somos Top” of Porto Editora and a Virtual Reality application that obtained the 2nd place in the Contest “Periodic Table: beyond 150 years”. He was Director of the Multimedia Department of the School of Media Arts and Design. He is currently Vice-President of the same institution and is a researcher at uniMAD. His research focuses on Augmented and Virtual Reality.

Main interests: Cybersecurity, Multimedia Systems, information technologies

name: Diogo Silva
cv:
Bio:

  • Diogo da Silva has a Master’s Degree in Basic Education (K6), both in social studies and in science.
  • With a solid background in computing and multimedia, he has focused his efforts on the application of technology in education, having participated and developed several projects that aim to enrich children’s lives through the conscientious use of technology.
  • He holds the position of Pedagogical Director of Visionarium – The STEAM Science Center, which will reopen its doors in 2021 and coordinates the STEAM department at EscolaGlobal, where he developed a curriculum focused on cooperative work and the development of soft skills.
  • More recently, he participated in European Schoolnet’s Skills for Industry: Robotics in Schools project and is participating in a European collaboration project aimed at using virtual reality as a socialization and education tool.

Main interests: Cybersecurity, Multimedia Systems, information technologies

name: Anabela Mesquita
cv:
Bio:

  • Anabela Mesquita – Professor at the Higher Institute of Accounting and Administration of Porto, Polytechnic of Porto, since 1990.
  • She was Vice President of the School between 2007 and 2018. Member of the Algoritmi Research Center, Universidade do Minho and CEOS. PP (founding member).
  • She was Director of the Center for Research in Communication and Education.
  • She is president of SPACE network, an international network of higher education institutions in the areas of management, entrepreneurship, hospitality, tourism, languages.
  • She participates / or in several European projects as a researcher / partner responsible and as a coordinator.
  • She has published numerous articles in magazines and conferences.
  • Member of the Scientific and Program Committee of several national and international conferences. Member of the editorial board and reviewer of the American publisher IGI Global.
  • Associate Editor of the Information Resources Management Journal and Co-Editor in Chief of the International Journal of Technology and Human Interaction. Associate Editor of Helyion Publishing. Evaluator and reviewer of Erasmus + projects.

Main Interests: Digital Transformation and Workforce; impact of information systems on organizations; use of technologies in education; elearning; Innovation.

name: Ana Paula Camarinha Teixeira
cv:
Bio:

  • Paula Camarinha holds a Ph.D. in Informatics (2015).
  • She is Senior Lecturer in the area of Information Technology at ISCAP/P.PORTO
  • Developed business activity for 12 years as head of Computer Center and Senior Analyst.
  • She was an invited researcher at the UP to University Project – UP2U.
  • Member of the scientific committee for national and international conferences and initiatives, as well as international journals.
  • Collaborates in the organization of several international scientific events
  • Collaborates as a peer reviewer in scientific journals and international conferences.
  • Collaborates with CEOS.PP, in the Information Systems Studies Unit
  • Develops several research activities in support of technologies for teaching and learning as well as research for the integration of ICT in school and social environment, culminating in the publication of articles indexed in conferences and scientific journals.

Main interests: Information Systems and Technologies, Information Management, and BCs in Computer Science among others.

name: Sílvia Lima Gonçalves Araújo
cv:
Bio:

  • Sílvia Araújo concluded her PhD in Language Sciences / Romance Linguistics in 2008 at the University of Minho / Université Paris 7 – Denis Diderot.
  • She is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Romance Studies of the University of Minho.
  • Her main research interests are corpus linguistics, technologies applied to languages and digital humanities. Related to these areas, she has coordinated projects funded by FCT (Perfide, PortLinguE) and the Support Program for Innovation and Development of Teaching and Learning, IDEA-UMinho (Active and Collaborative Learning Scenarios with Digital Tools).
  • Since 2008, she has conducted accredited training sessions on the pedagogical integration of technologies at different levels of education (basic, secondary and higher education).
  • She is a member of the Steering Committee of the Master’s Degree in Translation and Multilingual Communication, Director of the Master’s Degree in Digital Humanities, as well as the Coordinator of the Digital Humanities Research Group of the Center for Humanistic Studies of the University of Minho.
  • Furthermore, she coordinates the techLING annual international conference, devoted to the application of technology to languages and linguistics, which will reach its fifth edition in 2020.

Main interests: Information Systems and Technologies, Information Management, and BCs in Computer Science among others.

name: Tamara Aller Carreira
cv:
Bio:

  • Tamara Aller Carrera is an assistant professor at the Escola Superior de Educação of Bragança and the Polytechnic Institute of Maia.
  • Degree in Foreign Languages ​​English / Spanish.
  • Master in Spanish as a Second Language and Foreign Language from the University of Minho – Braga.
  • PhD in Language Sciences from the Faculty of Arts, University of Porto, in the area of ​​specialization in Didactics of Foreign Languages.
  • Responsible for the production and coordination of the continuous training course “Teacher of digital competence: innovation in foreign language teaching” at FLUP, qualified by the distinction of
    recognition, within the scope of the 2018 Educational InnovationAward.
  • Award given by Miríadax-Telefónica Educação Digital, recognized the MOOC as an initiative that stood out for its work to disseminate open knowledge in the Ibero-American Space, and for its positive impact on the digital transformation at university level in Portugal.
  • His research career has focused mainly on pedagogical innovation through the creation of digital teaching materials and the application of ICT tools in pedagogical practice, as well as on the development of teachers’ digital competence.
  • She also cooperated in the “Mu.SA: Museum Sector Alliance” project, funded by the European Erasmus + / Sector Competence Alliances program. A project, coordinated by the Hellenic Open University (HOU), from Greece, in partnership with the University of Porto, which aimed to support the continuous digital development of museum professionals.
  • In this context, a digital repository of Open Educational Resources to support an Open Online Course and Massive Online Specialization Course.
  • Professionally, she studied as a Spanish teacher at the Instituto Superior de Contabilidade e Administracao do Porto (ISCAP).
  • In addition, she acted as HIS examiner; e-trainer / e-tutor, responsible for creating, configuring and monitoring the tTraining of Spanish in e-learning.

name: Teresa Guarda
cv:
Bio:

  • Teresa Guarda obtained her PhD in Information Systems and Technologies in 2015 from the University of Minho.
  • She is a researcher at the ALGORITMI Research Center at the University of Minho, Portugal, (Intelligent Data Systems (IDS) Research Team, R&D Group in Information Systems and Technologies (IST)).
  • She is a member and responsible for Conferences and International Relations of the interdisciplinary research group BITrum, and a member and researcher at GSIS The Institute for a Global Sustainable Society.
  • It already has relevant indexed publications in the main research topics: Pervasive Systems, Marketing Intelligence, Intelligent Decision Support Systems, Intelligent Systems, Business Intelligence, Crowdsourcing, Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery, Data Security, Information Science, Smart Destinations, Internet-of-Things, Theory of Computation, Knowledge Management, Cybersecurity, Applied Social and Educational Technologies.
  • He has also been the organizer of numerous conferences and workshops, and reviewer of many indexed journals and conferences on these topics.
  • She has been a professor and researcher at various academic institutions in Portugal since 1991; she is currently director of the CIST Research and Innovation Center at the Faculty of Systems and Telecommunications at the State University of Santa Elena Province (Ecuador).
  • Member of the BITrum-Research Group research team in: the European project FIRE, “Fostering Integrative Research and Education”, in which European, Ecuadorian and Mexican academic institutions participate with the aim of developing interdisciplinary research capacities through the development of laboratory research and social innovation.
  • European project cycLAB, “Multidimensional development of bicycle mobility linked to scientific-technological studies, citizen movement and social assistance” in which academic institutions, energy agencies, private companies and Spanish and Portuguese municipalities participate; BITru-UPSE interinstitutional scientific collaboration glossary,

name: António Silva Pereira
cv:
Bio:

  • António Silva Pereira is a System Engineer and holds Computer Specialist Title.
  • He holds a Master in Finance and Management and an MBA in Management at ESAD.
  • He has important roles in companies like IBM, PricewaerhouseCoopers, TEBE, TMG, Fitor, Lankorst Euronet Group, Organtex China, etc.
  • Senior Lecturer in ISEP, Universidade do Minho, Católica, etc.
  • Organize and participate in many national and international events, congresses and presentations.
  • Member of several private and public organizations.
  • Developer and coordinator of many projects related with Organization and Information Systems.  

Main interests: Information Systems, Organizational Development, Strategy Development and Inovation Management.

name: Maria João Cunha
cv:
Bio:

  • Speech Therapist since 1984, lecturer since 1993 in the area of language disorders.
  • Coordinator of the Technical Scientific areaof Speech Therapy ate Health School of Polytechnic (ESS-P.Porto) Institute of Porto.
  • She was Director and President of the Scientific Technical Council of ESS-P.Porto.

name: Jorge Mendonça
cv:
Bio:

  • Jorge Mendonça is Adjunct Professor at the Instituto Superior de Engenharia of the Polytechnic Institute of Porto.
  • He holds a PhD in Statistics and Operational Research from the University of Vigo and a Master in Statistics and Probability from the Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon.
  • He has a degree in Educational Mathematics from the Faculty of Sciences of the University of Porto.
  • He is co-coordinator of the Erasmus-DRIVE-MATH project –
    Development of Innovative Mathematical Teaching Strategies in European Engineering Degree.
  • His main research areas are Engineering Education and Statistics (Survival analysis, Survey analysis).
  • He is the author or co-author of several conferences and scientific articles in engineering education and statistics.
  • He has a wealth of experience in organizing international events, workshops and seminars. He participated as a speaker, chairman and member of the scientific committee.
  • He has extensive experience in statistical analysis and interpretation of results.
  • He applied Eduscrum as an active learning methodology in his classes.
  • He has supervised and evaluated several internship projects in various areas of engineering.
  • He is currently a researcher at SIIS (Social Innovation and Interactive Systems).

Main interests: Interactive Learning

name: Paula Flores
cv:
Bio:

  • Paula Alves de Quadros Flores holds a Ph.D. in Educational Sciences in Educational Technology at the University of Trás-os-Montes and Alto Douro, a Master in Educational Management and Planning from Portucalense University and a BA in Basic Education.
  • She is an assistant professor at the Polytechnic of Porto, School of Education, being Coordinator of the Technical Course Scientific Unit of Supervised Pedagogical Practice and responsible for the curricular unit Initiation to Pedagogical Practice III (Licentiate in Basic Education).
  • She teaches in curricular units within the Supervised Educational Practice.
  • She is an integrated member of InED (Center for Research and Innovation in Education) and coordinates the IFITIC Project (Innovate with ICT in Initial Teacher Education to promote
    renewal in Pre-school Education and in the 1st and 2nd CEB).

name: Paulo Proença
cv:
• Paulo Proença is a professor in Computer Engineering Department (DEI) School of Engineering of the Polytechnic Institute of Porto (ISEP-IPP). 
  • He completed the academic part of the Doctoral Program in Informatics Engineering (PRODEI) at Faculdade de Engenharia do Porto (FEUP) and his research work is in web ontologies.
  • He holds a MSc in Electrical and Computer Engineering at FEUP. 
  • The research project consisted of developing a multimedia application for virtual visits to museums. At DEI, he teaches courses in the areas of computer applications architecture.
Main interests: Software patterns, Architectural patterns, Distributed and decentralized software systems

name: Eduardo Murad
cv:
Bio:

  • Doctor in Communication (USP), Advertising (UFF) and Marketing Specialist (ESPM).
  • Professor at the Fluminense Federal University (UFF/Brazil). Consultant partner at Orgânica, Training and Development, consultant member at HUB757, associate consultant at Makemake, consultant at Rede Consultoria (Portugal) and mediator at PodCast Desconstruindo, having worked with sustainability, entrepreneurship, marketing, leadership and human development for the last 20 years .
  • Implemented Team Building, Leadership Development, Impact Communication, Corporate Pitch, Leadership Communication and Negotiation projects for companies such as Shell, VALE, Grupo Pão de Açúcar, Carrefour, Portal do Voluntário and Accenture, DNV, Geosoft, Projac – Globo/ RJ, CSU, Andrade Gutierrez, IBGE, Queiroz Galvão, Engetec, Oi and Totvs.
  • He is a Professional and Team Coach (SLAC), facilitator and facilitator of online groups and Storyteller.

name: Joaquim Lopes
cv:
Bio:

  • Joaquim Lopes is a web developer a content manegement sistems  specialist with a tow decades of successful experience in developing websites for managemente sistems .
  • Joaquim Lopes is a computer science teatsher and prefere Programing subjects, like  Visual Basic , Python, PHP , SQL, JScript and computer technologies. Joaquim is a srong believer in the power of positive thinking.
  • Joaquim enjoys a good Netflix, Likes to read  a good book,  binge but can also be found on jogging country roads.”

name: José Rodrigues
cv:
Bio:

  • José Augusto Rodrigues has a Master’s degree on Computer Engineering (specialization in Graphic and Multimedia Systems) from ISEP and attendance on the PhD in Information and Communication Technologies of the University of Vigo.
  • On is master thesis he worked on eye tracking applied on Marketing and developed the E2M system.
  • He is part of the CVIG Group as a Development Technician, and he is participating in the “Cognitive CMMS” Project of the UMinho.

Main interests: Eye Tracking, Interactive Systems, Multimedia, Educational Technology, Voice and Face Recognition, Computer Vision, Virtual and Augmented Reality, IOT among others.

name: Rafael Pereira
cv:
Bio:

  • Has experience in programming in C #, Unity 3D and 3D modeling in Blender 3D or 3DS Max.
  • He is currently teaching the disciplines of Virtual Environments and Applied Game Development at the Polytechnic Institute of Cavado and Ave. He also has experience and interest in Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality, having developed projects in Unity 3D for Android and iOS.
  • Currently, he is part of the team of game developers in Unity 3D for the company RedCatPig.

Main interests: Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality; Unity 3D and 3D modeling;
Virtual Environments and Applied Game Development

name: Paulo Sérgio Teixeira de Magalhães
cv:
Bio: 

  • Paulo Magalhães has a Master’s Degree in Graphic Systems and Multimedia in Computer Science from ISEP.
  • He is a senior IT manager, passionate about innovation and design, with extensive knowledge of the media and digital landscape.
  • He is also a digital strategist responsible for leading project teams and creating intuitive solutions to every facet of IT problems.
  • Creative Director with strong communication skills, experienced in designing and developing projects for a wide range of clients.
  • Critical thinker and researcher.
  • Excellent problem solving and conceptual thinking skills.
  • He is the founder and CEO of THESIGNOFTIME-IT, Lda.
  • Until 2015, he was coordinator of the System Information department at the Polytechnic Institute of Porto and professor of Multimedia disciplines.
  • He has done applied research at the GILT Laboratory (Graphic Interaction and Learning Technologies) at ISEP.
  • He was coordinator of several interns and taught more than 8,000 hours on topics such as Multimedia, Audiovisual and Project Management.

Main interests: Interactive Systems, Multimedia, Graphics, Motion, Interaction, IOT, Virtual and Augmented Reality

name: Horácio Macedo
cv:
Bio: 

  • Horácio Macedo graduated in Computer Engineering from the Instituto Superior de Engenharia of Porto in 2002, having developed his professional activity in the field of distance learning.
  • First at Fundação IPP and since 2008 at ISEP where he was responsible for the e-learning and multimedia office for 12 years, having implemented online support for all ISEP subjects.

Main interests: interactive learning, multimedia, programming, learning management systems.

name: Ana Claúdia Albergaria
cv:
Bio: 

  • Social research / Construction of Social Indicators / Instruments for the Collection and Analysis of data / publications /articles.
  • School Management – Coordination of educational processes / Pedagogical coordination of formation
  • Trainer / teacher / facilitator of sessions in the area of ​​social education; sociology, psychology, participatory methodologies; methods of social inquiry; development community; Citizenship Education; Relationship between Education and Society; sociology of Education.
  • Quality of Organizations / Strategic planning / qualification in the 3rd sector / quality in education and vocational education / EQAVET.
  • Project design, development, monitoring and evaluation: equality of opportunities, participation and citizenship; ethical minorities; social education; entrepreneurship; organization and development of cultural/social events.
  • Social Area / Social Reinsertion (Fight against poverty / social exclusion / Local, social and personal development / Projects to Fight Poverty and Exclusion Social, Inclusion Strategies)
  • Planning and management of teams/human resources and processes.

name: Rui Marques
cv:
Bio: 

  • Rui Marques is a professor in the Department of Computer Engineering at Instituto Superior de Engenharia do Porto and also a Chief Information Officer at Flamingo – Jewellery Industry S.A., responsible for technology and information portfolio, recently dedicated to web platform innovation, architecture, privacy and security. With a Master’s degree in Knowledge Technologies and Decision Support, he is currently a Ph.D. student in Universidad de Vigo on the subject of Intelligent Recommender Systems. Other research interests include Automated Assessment technologies and overall improvement in Education technologies.

name: Hugo Barbosa
cv:
Bio:

  • Hugo Barbosa has a degree in Computer Engineering – Computers and Systems (2006);
  • He received his master’s degree in Computer Engineering – Graphics and Multimedia Systems (2009),
    both at the Polytechnic School of Engineering of Porto (ISEP).
  • Today he works at
    education, games and engineering areas with computer-based professional activity
    networks and multimedia.
  • Since 2010 he has also been a professor at Universidade Lusófona do Porto (ULP) in computer courses
    Engineering and more recently in Audiovisual Communication and Multimedia and Degree in
    Video game and multimedia applications. He collaborated with Medical Learning
    Investigation of methodologies in the area of ​​interactive applications and Multimedia Systems
    by I & amp; D GILT / ISEP.
  • He is currently a PhD student in Computer Engineering at the Faculty of
    The Engineering of Porto.

Main interests: Serious Games, Virtual Reality,
Simulation, Player Adaptation, Cybersecurity and Computer Networks. Author of several publications in these areas. He supports newspapers and conferences as an editorial member or reviewer, as well as member of the scientific committee of these editions.

name: Leila Ribeiro
cv:
Bio:

  • PhD student at the University of Porto, Course in Education Science, thesis on Regulation of Distance Education in THE HEIs in Portugal. Study on Regulation, Evaluation and Quality in Europe and Africa.
  • Master’s degree in Education from Universidade Paulista. Researcher at the School of the Future of USP.
  • National Coordinator of the EAD Pedagogy Course at Estácio de Sá University, developing products for the implementation of the course in the modality; Professor in the pedagogy and administration course at Estácio de Sá University. Expertise in Education in a company with emphasis on Development of skills and building professional training environments in a distance mode. She is managing partner of the Educational Network in Portugal and partner of +Educação in Brazil. He works in teacher training projects in EAD in Portugal, Angola and Brazil.

name: Joana Sofia Gândara Fernandes
cv:
Bio:

  • Joana Fernandes has a degree in Philosophy (2018) from the University of Minho, Braga.
  • She speaks Portuguese, English and Spanish.
  • She is currently doing the second year of her Master’s Degree in Digital Humanities at the University of Minho.
  • She is currently doing an internship at the International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory-INL-integrated in the Masters course.
  • In December 2020, she published an article in collaboration with her Masters colleagues in the online magazine H2D Humanidades Digitais entitled “The gamification of the learning process: Languages and Humanities”.
  • She and her fellow masters developed a gaming app called “Nano Submarine” in collaboration with INL using Buildbox.
  • She is resourceful, goal-oriented, driven, and adaptable.

Main interests:   Augmented Reality

name: Ana Luísa da Mota Antunes Ribeiro
cv:
Bio:

  • Ana Luisa Ribeiro a degree in Applied Languages (2019) from the University of Minho.
  • She is currently in her second year on the master’s degree of Digital Humanities at University of Minho.
  • She is currently an intern at siosLIFE, a software company.
  • She speaks English, Spanish, Italian and French.
  • Since 2017, she has been studying mandarin and Korean.
  • In 2020, she had a published article along with her colleagues in the H2D online called “Digital Methodological pathways applied in literary education”.
  • She and her colleagues created a game in 2020 called “Healthy Mania” using the software BuildBox for INL (International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory).

Main interests: Interactive Systems, Virtual and Augmented Reality, Programming, Web Design, Digital Content Creation, Web Development, Languages, among others.

name: Nancy Amaral Gonçalves
cv:
Bio:

  • Nancy Gonçalves completed her degree in Applied Languages in the University of Minho in 2019.
  • She is currently in her second year in the University of Minho taking her master’s degree in Digital Humanities.
  • She is currently participating in an internship in a software company called siosLife.
  • She currently knows the English, Portuguese, French and the Spanish language.
  • She had published with a group of her colleagues in her master’s degree an article in the H2D online in 2020 called “Digital methodological pathways applied in literary education”.
  • In 2020, she and her group in the subject of Content Creation in Virtual Environment created a game called “Healthy Mania” using the software BuildBox for the INL (International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory).
  • She is a hard-working, ambitious, dedicated individual who is constantly looking to improve and who faces all challenges with a motivating spirit.

Main interests: Virtual and Augmented Reality; Web Interfaces; Creating and Developing Digital Contents; Marketing; Storytelling; Programming; Languages; among others.

name: Ricardo Ramiro
cv:
Bio:

  • Ricardo Ramiro has a degree on Computer Science from UFP.
  • He was an Erasmus student in Lodz, Poland.
  • He is currently studying a Multimedia and Graphical Master’s degree on ISEP.
  • He was an INOV Contacto practioner in Altran Innovation Spain.
  • He worked as an IT consultant for more than seven years in Madrid, Barcelona and London.

Main interests: Multimedia, Voice recognition, IoT, Data science, Business Intelligence, among others.

name: Ana Sofia Marques
cv:
Bio:

  • Ana Sofia Marques Nogueira has a degree in European Languages and Literatures from the University of Minho.
  • She is currently finishing a master’s degree in Digital Humanities at the University of Minho.
  • She will be developing a gamified virtual tour as an internship project for the International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory (INL).
  • In 2020, she and her master’s degree colleagues had an article published in the Digital Humanities online journal H2D titled “The gamification of the learning process: Languages and humanities”.
  • Along with her master’s colleagues, she developed a mobile game for children named “Nano Submarine” in collaboration with INL about one of their fields of research – water quality – using Buildbox.
  • Also during her master’s, she developed an Augmented Reality and a Virtual Reality app, both made using Unity.

Main interests: Game Based Learning, UI/UX Design, Game Development, Digital Marketing, Virtual and Augmented Reality, Data Analysis

name: Sofia Canelas
cv:
Bio:

  • Sofia Canelas is currently a Master’s Degree student on Informatics Engineering, specialized in the field of Graphic Systems and Multimedia, from ISEP.
  • She has a degree in Design in Multimedia from FCTUC and an artistic specialized course in Communication Design, with specialization in Multimedia and Web Design from EASR.

Main interests: UI/UX Design, Web Design, Graphic Design and Interactive Media. Her purpose is to offer creative solutions through design, innovation and technology.

name: Miguel Sousa
cv:
• Miguel Sousa is currently a Master’s Degree student on Informatics Engineering, specialized in the field of Graphic Systems and Multimedia, from ISEP.
  • He has a degree in Computer Engeneering at ESTG.  
  • Currently working as a frontend developer in a company that works in the pharmaceutical area
  • Apart from being a web developer, he is also a Photography enthusiast
  • Currently he is writting a thesis for his masters based on The usage of Virtual Assistants for Online Gambling
  • Also he  purposes to develop na interactive website for siis

Main interests: UI/UX Design, Web Design, Web development, Voice Assistant and Photography.

name: João Tomás Barreira
cv:
• João Tomás Barreira is currently a Master’s Degree student on Informatics Engineering, specialized in the field of Graphic Systems and Multimedia, from ISEP. 
  • He has a degree in Computer Engineering from Lusófona University of Porto.
  • Currently working on his Master’s Degree Thesis on developing an Interface Software between BCIs and (mainly) electric wheel chairs.

Main interests: Web/Game Development, Web/Graphic Design, Animation making, Image/Video Editing, Tech Enthusiast

name: José Campos
cv:
• Graduate and postgraduate courses in computer engineering and networks at Universiade Lusíada.

Main interests:
System Administration: Windows and Linux Servers, directory, networks and web services.

Main interests: Interactive political communication, real-time interaction, Usability and Accessibility
